dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3529 IH: WIC Improvement Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Brat introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the special supplemental nutrition program for women, infants, and children to cover certain vitamins.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the WIC Improvement Act.

section.header: Eligibility to purchase certain vitamins under the WIC program
section.text: Section 17(b)(14) of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 (42 U.S.C. 1786(b)(14)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking (14) Supplemental foods means those foods and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: The term supplemental foods means those foods or multivitamin dietary supplements

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The term multivitamin dietary supplement means a multivitamin dietary supplement—

clause.text: labeled in accordance with part 101 of title 21, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of the WIC Improvement Act); and
that increases the availability of low-cost, high nutrient alternatives for the population served by the program authorized by this section.
